word_mean: 〔NA〕腓骨：小腿两骨中位于外侧的较小的骨，近侧与胫骨构成关节，远侧以韧带与胫骨相连

sentence.Network_en: He stumbled when playing on the field and injured his fibula.
sentence.Network_cn: 他打球的时候摔了一跤,腓骨骨折了.

sentence.Network_en: There is also tender pain in the upper section of the fibula.
The incidence of severe open fractures of tibia and fibula is increasing.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin, brooch', perhaps related to figere 'to fix'. The bone is so named because the shape it makes with the tibia resembles a clasp, the fibula being the tongue

entry.def: Your fibula is the outer bone of the two bones in the lower part of your leg.

means.word_mean: 1. the outer and thinner of the two bones of the human leg between the knee and ankle

auth_sentence.content: The three long bones are your femur, your tibia and your fibula.
auth_sentence.res_content: The three long bones are your femur, your tibia and your fibula.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The three long bones are your femur, your tibia and your fibula.

auth_sentence.content: He was born missing the fibula in each leg and with malformed feet.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was born missing the fibula in each leg and with malformed feet.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was born missing the fibula in each leg and with malformed feet.

auth_sentence.content: He was born without a fibula in both legs and had his legs amputated below the knee before his first birthday.
